phrases: We are almost done with this area.
We missed two platoons or so.
Watch for them.
Roger.
Message from Naotsugu.
The enemy might be approaching.
I will report once I have visual.
Tohya!
Lure them out!
Got it!
But how far can Miss Minori see in this darkness?
She is using magic eye drops that Naotsugu lent her.
She should be able to see like a cat for a full day.
So far, it is all gone according to plan.
It has to go well.
I forced everyone into agreeing with me.
A night attack?
What are you talking about?
You said you were just getting them to evacuate!
Those kids cannot protect the city alone...
No, they did not say they could.
That is why they are attacking.
What?
The goblins are not protecting anything.
If we worry about protecting something, we cannot beat them.
So we attack them.
That is the plan.
But...
And when they are attacked, they will get spooked.
They are not well-trained, so that will slow them down.
And their attacks will be more sporadic and more easily defended.
Honestly, it is not a bad strategy.
Yeah, that is it.
We will be with them.
Do not worry.
It is going to be a long night.
Yeah.
But we are not alone, are we?
As long as they have something to protect, anyone would...
Marie tells me they are going to be defending Choushu.
Naotsugu and his group are preparing a surprise attack.
What?
We have not even finished discussing things here.
If you were actually there, seeing it,
you naturally would not want to just ignore it.
The three of us hold all power over decisions in this matter, which includes sending troops.
We must quickly come to a consensus before the next full conference.
A plot?
You are saying the goblin attack is an adventurer plot?
If the adventurers had acted to weaken them from the start, this would not have happened.
Though I think calling it a plot is a rather drastic leap...
Baron Krendit,
right now, it is important that no one withhold their thoughts.
Is not that why we have held this conference without them?
To be honest, I do not expect Choushu to last for long.
Most likely, their next target will be Tsukuba, Lord Kiliva's territory.
Or possibly...
Maihama?
A Lazy, Cowardly Princess
A Lazy, Cowardly Princess.
What?
Are they still having their little secret meeting?
It is probably about something they really do not want us to hear.
They have not settled on a course of action,
and they have to consider their pride.
They would prefer not to owe the adventurers anything.
The first group they are likely to turn to is...
Yes, the guardians they have held in high esteem since ancient times...
The Izumo Knights.
But...
Then, as we thought...
Yes, none of us has any idea why,
but the Knights of Izumo are gone.
Our recon teams report
that several of the fortresses they once used are empty.
And they found no corpses or signs of combat.
It is as if they have been spirited away.
But in any case, the fact is that they are gone.
Th-Then our only hope is for all the lords to unite and attack the goblins...
Strategically speaking,
surrounding them is the most feasible plan.
We force them to lay siege to a well-defended stronghold city,
and when they are tired, we surround them with a large, combined army, and attack.
Oh, my...
That sounds like you are telling us to sacrifice one of the cities.
You are not...
going to tell me to sacrifice Tsukuba since it is the one they are likely to target, are you?
No, no one's saying that.
Of course not!
I will not let Tsukuba be sacrificed!
Calm down, Lord Kiliva.
Let us take a break.
They are approaching!
Two platoons.
Ten or so...
Tohya's succeeded in luring them out.
Okay...
Start the countdown!
Five,
four,
three,
two,
one...
Zero!
Willow Spirits!
I have rooted them!
Okay!
Here I go.
Icicle Blade!
Thank you, Rudy!
Save your big spells and attack small-scale for now.
I will back you up for thirty seconds.
Got it.
Second wave at two of the clock.
Flare Arrow!
Maestro Echo!
Wonderful, Miss Isuzu.
Not now!
Seconds Left
Once your cool down finishes, attack again!
Leave it to me.
If they are not able to rely on the Izumo Knights...
That would make us their only other option.
As long as we are here, in this world,
we will not be able to avoid fighting in its wars.
But it would not be a good idea for either side
to hand over its soldiers easily.
We will need to do this properly, you are saying?
Yes, and for that, I would like us to agree on something in advance.
Another of your plans?
Way to go, villain in glasses.
It is nothing that special.
I think we three should decide our roles in advance.
Our roles, huh?
The goblin attack...
I have never seen Father look so serious.
How intense will the fighting be?
It will have to be Tsukuba.
It is well defended,
and should last a long time.
But who will tell Lord Kiliva?
He will lose more than a few fields and outlying villages.
In the worst case, most of the population.
I am sure everyone is thinking in the back of their minds
that asking the adventurers would be the right move.
Yes...
If they die, they return to life.
But that would mean owing them a large debt.
Which is why we avoid showing them our vulnerability,
while getting information from them by any means necessary.
And they cannot learn that the Izumo Knights are gone, no matter what.
Ultimately, we know nothing about them.
We need them to be our shield, even if it means lying to them.
They have finally called us?
I hear the West Wind Brigade has arrived, too.
Yes, they just contacted me.
It is huge.
They will have to wait until the conference ends...
Well, if it is not...
Um
Is something wrong?
I would imagined you would be asleep in your soft bed at this hour.
It is true that you may
see me as nothing but a lazy, cowardly girl.
But I am also a member of the duke's family.
There are nights when I am too worried to sleep.
I apologize.
Well?
You seemed to have something you wanted to say.
Did not you say that freedom requires resolve?
Yes.
I have not forgotten those words.
That is all I wanted to say.
Yes, we are all right.
I think we have wiped out all the enemies in this area.
We are resting now.
Proceeding north-northwest, yes?
Yes.
Three kilometers or so.
Roger.
You and Nyanta both be careful.
Mage's Gauntlets?
Yes!
Nyanta identified them for me.
They are an item for magical attackers.
As long as you are above level 25, you can equip them.
Level 25?
Then they cannot be that great...
But they are the first item we acquired by working together.
Yeah.
We worked together in Lagranda Forest to get them.
Does not that make them an amazing treasure?
Yes, that is right.
But what do we do with them?
We cannot all use them.
Um...
Why do not we let Rudy use them?
You said it is an item for magical attackers, right?
That is right.
Rudy's the only mage in our group.
Um, but something that important...
That is not like you, Rudy!
Since when are you so modest?
What do you think I am?
B-But...
Well, are you sure?
They look good on you, Rudy.
Let us get going.
We will head down into the ravine, keeping watch as we move.
Okay...
I swear by these gauntlets that I will defeat even more next time.
Do not get too fired up.
What?
Is it bad to be fired up?
No, let us do our best!
And so, for these reasons,
we lords of the Freedom Cities of Eastal feel
that in this emergency situation...
Hey, we are not getting anywhere.
They are probably waiting for us to say something.
We both want more information about what the other's thinking, to gain an advantage.
So we will go with the plan.
I will talk about agreeing to send troops, to try and gain information.
If this is how they want to play it, there is no need to hold back.
If anyone knows the status of the Izumo Knights, please tell me.
Oh, that is even worse than I expected.
It seems clear that, for some reason, the Izumo Knights will not be coming.
We cannot bring the Izumo Knights into a war like this!
I would rather ask the Akihabara Round Table.
With Akihabara in danger, why do you not rise?
You are asking us to send troops?
W-Well...
I would thought the purpose of this conference was to hear
each individual lord's thoughts...
Or did you simply hope to hear our opinions?
I-I would heard the Akihabara knights were unmatched in combat...
If you are using knights to mean a standing force, ready for battle,
neither Akihabara nor the Round Table has any such thing.
Then what are you adventurers good for?
What does that mean?
What else?
The adventurers' abilities are a blessing from the gods!
You have a duty to save the land!
That is news to me...
What nonsense is that?!
You are invincible, immortal.
And despite that, you would abandon your duty to the land?!
You should be ashamed!
Shut up!
First off, we are not citizens of the Freedom Cities!
That is why we were not summoned to the conference before.
Am I wrong?!
I do not know what plot you have devised,
but we have no obligation to accede to your demands.
Do not you agree, Baron Krendit?!
Th-That is not...
We did not mean...
Well...
We are most certainly not plotting to get Akihabara to send troops.
Then it was Lord Kiliva's individual request
that Akihabara send troops, not the will of the League of Freedom Cities?
Are you saying that I am acting for my own benefit here?!
It is not the will of the entire League.
But it is also true that many of us within the League feel that way.
Or will the proud, mighty warriors of Akihabara
stand aside while Yamato faces its hour of peril?
We are not pets...
You guys are immortal, so go and kill the goblins for us?
Anyone who believed that, and sent their comrades to the battlefield
could never gain the people of Akihabara's trust!
Was that too much?
The adventurers risk losing their memories.
Anyone would get mad about that, not just you.
And it is your job to oppose sending troops.
But...
Yeah, that may have been a bit much.
I am not sure where we go from here...
Lenessia...
What...
What am I doing?
You are looking as beautiful as ever.
Like a fairy on a lake, on a moonlit night.
I should not have come here.
I should not have come.
I should not have come.
I want to put on my flannel pajamas and go to bed...
I want to put my face down on a cold table and lie there.
Are you not slacking off today?
Did I imagine that?
I am sure I heard it.
No, it does not matter...
Of course I want to slack off, but...
Lenessia...
Sir Crusty...
Yes, Princess Lenessia?
I am going to Akihabara.
Accompany me.
To Akihabara?
Why?
To raise an army of volunteers.
Impossible...
What can a single woman do?
Speaking to a foreign band of knights without permission?
That far exceeds her authority...
No, the Round Table's representative is going with her...
That could change things.
I am sure that is likely to be a lot of work.
Yes.
Then why?
You said that adventurers were free.
I am just a stupid girl, so I do not really understand politics.
But I think that when you ask someone for something,
you should show respect.
As a member of the duke's family,
that is what my father and grandfather taught me.
That is why
I do not think we should be hiding things from you.
Including the fact that the Izumo Knights are missing!
What has she done?
She is told them our secret!
Well, now you have done it.
When I take responsibility, apologize with me.
And, exactly what are you planning?
I see there are things even you do not know.
Nothing.
I do not have any plan at all.
But...
As a member of the Cowen family, I do not wish to be insulting.
Grandfather...
Continue.
Adventurers are free.
They are more free than we are.
It is true that we may be weaker than they are.
But that does not mean that, in our weakness, we can become aggressive.
We do not have the right to take advantage
of our weakness and use them as tools!
I shall go to Akihabara, and ask the adventurers directly.
Sir Crusty said that adventurers are free.
So if any of them will agree to help us,
why would we stop them?
I shall find even ten or fifteen that will agree to help us.
I learned from my grandfather that showing respect
does not mean using fancy words.
I will go there myself, to stand in the street,
and speak to each adventurer individually!
Princess Lenessia!
It is fine.
She was just very nervous.
Can I leave the rest of this to you?
I could not.
That would be a waste.
So what will you do?
Will you accept her resolve, or not?
The final decision lies with you.
A bird?
It is scary out here at night.
There are probably all kinds of enemies still out here.
It is true.
We have only defeated a tiny percentage of the goblins.
No matter how many we kill, it may not matter.
It is even scarier when the fighting starts.
You can trip on roots and soft ground.
Yeah, you lose your balance easily.
I am always anxious because I never know when the enemy will appear.
Maybe it is because you are on higher alert at night...
Like for the scent of the monsters.
Yeah...
I hate that scent.
But...
It is okay to do our best!
It is okay for us to try and save them!
Yeah, it is just fine!
Yes, of course.
If you would leave behind people in trouble, how can you be an adventurer?
That is right...
We do not need to think about anything else.
We will all protect the people we care about.
That is all there is to it.
And as a shrine priestess,
my job is to keep us all safe.
Why are you laughing, my lord?
I have never seen Crusty looking like that.
He was totally overwhelmed.
That princess impresses me.
I did not expect her to do that there.
It is about respect, huh?
Respect?
Yes.
Even if the Round Table promised to send troops,
it would not mean Akihabara would act.
Because, as she said, adventurers are free.
If you want them to act, you need to persuade each one individually.
And she seemed to understand that perfectly.
She said she would do all she could to show respect at that meeting.
But in a way, is not that obvious?
Yes, you are right.
But everyone there was about to ignore it.
Including us.
What is that light?
The city of Akihabara.
It is night...
But the light is so warm...
She may be the one who saves the Freedom Cities of Eastal from the dead end
in which they have found themselves.
That lazy, cowardly princess...
She finds herself in a town she does not know
with things she is never seen,
things she is never heard,
and people she is never met.
She learns how big the world is, and how tiny she is.
She cries out her resolve and her hope.
And her words drive the adventurers to action.
Expeditionary Force
Next time: Expeditionary Force.
Always look thirty seconds ahead.
